result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 2/15/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.

Defendant Anthony Lee Coleman in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Anthony Lee Coleman in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
BRANCH 22 FOR 28.  Pursuant to negotiations, case is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing in case#15CF1208.

BRANCH 28 HELD IN BRANCH 26.  Attorney Calvin R Malone in court, defendant Anthony Lee Coleman not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing hearing.  Defense counsel requests new date.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 28.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Calvin R Malone in court, defendant Anthony Lee Coleman not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has three cases before the court.
Case could not proceed to plea hearing on today's date as court is in trial on an unrelated case.
Case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Anthony Lee Coleman not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Malone involved in a Jury Trial in another Court.  Matter adjourned.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Anthony Lee Coleman not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Anthony Lee Coleman not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time as negotiations are still on going.  Case remains calendared in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered $2,000 cash bail ($750 reinstated, $1,250 remains due)

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.

Bail hearing proceeded. Arguments by counsel.  Defense requests status date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($750.00) ad
Defendant picked up on warrant.  Attorney Calvin Malone in court on another matter.   Matter scheduled for Return on Warrant.
Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant did not appear.  Bench warrant to remain in effect.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
The court ordered any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

*CASE HEARD WITHOUT CIRCUIT COURT FILE*  Matter before the Court to address Justice Point violation.  Parties in receipt of reports. Statements made by the state and defense.  On state's motion, the Court orders Bench Warrant to Issue.

*case remains set for 6-02-15 at 8:30 a.m.*

Matter before the Court for Status conference.  Defendant found competent to proceed in 15CF1208; case returned to preliminary hearing court.  Status date selected with the parties.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Matter before the Court for Scheduling conference.  Defense reports that competency was raised in defendant's new case (15CF1208) with a doctor's return date of 4-15-15.  This matter set for status conference same date.  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Defendant Anthony Lee Coleman in court with Anne Jaspers for attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Anthony Lee Coleman in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
    Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #14CF5400, including the No Contact Order, that are attached to the complaint. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Michael Driscoll.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed. Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/17/15.
